Meanwhile, arch-villain Lex Luthor is out of jail and about to wreak havoc on the world with technology stolen from Superman's home planet of Krypton. Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey.(n)

programme.title: Training Day
programme.desc: A cop embarks on his first day in narcotics, partnering a seasoned officer whose willingness to flout the rules forces him to question everything he has learnt. As they resort to extreme measures to crack a case, the rookie is left battling his conscience in a dangerous situation. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke, Scott Glenn and Tom Berenger.

programme.title: The Face of an Angel
programme.desc: A journalist and a documentary-maker become obsessed with the murder case they are covering. Fact-based drama inspired by Amanda Knox's case and the death of Meredith Kercher in 2007, starring Daniel Bruhl, Kate Beckinsale and Cara Delevingne.

programme.title: Fur: An Imaginary Portrait of Diane Arbus
programme.desc: Fictionalised biopic imagining the events that inspired the photographer's unusual art. Bored with her marriage and work as her husband's assistant on fashion shoots, she becomes fascinated with her mysterious neighbour, a former sideshow performer who has excessive body hair. Starring Nicole Kidman, Robert Downey Jr and Ty Burrell.

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer.

programme.title: Who's That Knocking at My Door
programme.desc: Harvey Keitel plays a tough Italian-American who prefers hanging out with a rough and ready street gang to spending time with his increasingly frustrated girlfriend. Urban crime story, with Zina Bethune and Anne Colette.

programme.title: Dangerous Liaisons
programme.desc: A philandering aristocrat in 18th-century France schemes with his manipulative former lover to seduce a virtuous young woman. As their conspiracy becomes ever more tangled, events take an unexpected turn. Stephen Frears' Oscar-winning drama of sexual politics, based on Pierre Choderlos de Laclos' novel, starring John Malkovich, Glenn Close, Michelle Pfeiffer, Swoosie Kurtz, Uma Thurman and Keanu Reeves.

programme.title: A Fistful of Dollars
programme.desc: A mysterious gunslinger rides into a town on the Mexican border divided by two warring families. After killing the henchmen of one clan, he seems to have made it clear where his loyalties lie and is hired by their rivals. However, he is secretly planning to play them off against each other to his own advantage. Sergio Leone's Western, with Clint Eastwood making his first appearance as The Man with No Name alongside Gian Maria Volonte and Marianne Koch.

programme.title: Flags of Our Fathers
programme.desc: The stories of three of the men in the famous photograph of US servicemen raising their flag on the island of Iwo Jima. After returning home from the battlefield, the veterans grapple with an increasing sense of survivor guilt as they struggle to adjust to everyday life. Clint Eastwood's Second World War drama, starring Adam Beach, Ryan Phillippe, Jesse Bradford, Jamie Bell and Paul Walker.

programme.title: Magic in the Moonlight
programme.desc: An English magician who exposes fake psychics is approached by his friend to prove that a medium is a fraud exploiting a wealthy family. As he watches the spiritualist at work, he begins to believe that she is the genuine article, challenging his previously unshakeable scepticism. Woody Allen's 1920s-set romantic comedy, with Colin Firth and Emma Stone.

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: A troubled philosophy professor begins teaching at a small town college, but struggles to find any meaning in his life. He finds some measure of happiness in his friendship with a student, and when they overhear a stranger's conversation, it spurs the tortured academic on to a course of action that changes everything. Woody Allen's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone and Parker Posey.

programme.title: Internal Affairs
programme.desc: A crooked cop uses his badge and uniform as a cover for his unsavoury money-making schemes and is prepared to murder anyone who stands in his way. A zealous investigator vows to bring him to justice, but the cunning detective responds by turning his adversary's wife against him. Crime thriller, starring Richard Gere, Andy Garcia, Laurie Metcalf, Nancy Travis and William Baldwin.

programme.title: The Sea Inside
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a fisherman who is paralysed from the neck down in a diving accident. After spending years dependent on others to take care of him, he decides to fight for the legal right to end his own life. Starring Javier Bardem, Belen Rueda and Lola Duenas. In Spanish, Catalan and Galician.(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A detective is sent to Alaska to investigate a murder during a month when the sun does not set. Sleep deprivation starts to take its toll, and he accidentally shoots his partner dead. He tries to cover it up, but the criminal they were hunting has seen everything and blackmails the cop into helping him escape justice. Thriller directed by Christopher Nolan, starring Al Pacino, Robin Williams and Hilary Swank.(n)

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: A war veteran criss-crosses America with his disabled brother in tow as he builds a new career as a renowned prizefighter. However, his ruthless determination to make it to the top drives him to betray the people closest to him. Drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Marilyn Maxwell, Arthur Kennedy, Paul Stewart and Ruth Roman.(n)

programme.title: Hell Is for Heroes
programme.desc: A rebellious soldier defies orders to lead two men on a secret attack on a German pillbox, but his mission fails and the other two soldiers are killed. Court-martialled for his actions, he remains convinced his plan was sound and ignores the sentence to make a second attempt at destroying the emplacement. Second World War adventure, with Steve McQueen, James Coburn and Bobby Darin.(n)

programme.title: The Necessary Death of Charlie Countryman
programme.desc: A troubled American travels to Romania in the aftermath of his mother's death. He becomes obsessed with a cellist he meets who is concealing a violent past. His efforts to romance her could cost him his life following a run-in with her brutally violent husband. Drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Evan Rachel Wood and Mads Mikkelsen.(n)

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: A charming psychopath meets a tennis professional on a train and suggests that they each commit a murder on the other's behalf. However, when the deranged man goes through with his part of the deal, the sportsman faces a race against time to prove his innocence. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, starring Robert Walker, Farley Granger and Ruth Roman.(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: The highly strung producer of a Washington news bureau falls for a handsome but arrogant and totally untalented new anchorman, but is unaware a humble reporter friend is deeply infatuated with her. Comedy, starring Holly Hunter, William Hurt and Albert Brooks. Featuring an uncredited cameo from Jack Nicholson.(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski.(n)

programme.title: Dead Calm
programme.desc: A husband and wife take a yachting trip to help recover from the death of their son. While out on the open water the couple spot a sinking ship and manage to save the only person left on board - but they come to bitterly regret their good deed when the situation turns dark and a fraught battle of wits ensues. Thriller, based on a novel by Charles Williams, with Sam Neill, Nicole Kidman and Billy Zane.(n)

programme.title: Spy Game
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is on the verge of retirement, but when he learns his former protege has been thrown into a Chinese prison and is awaiting execution, he decides to launch a perilous and ill-advised rescue attempt. Thriller, starring Brad Pitt, Robert Redford, Catherine McCormack and Stephen Dillane.(n)

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: A Brooklyn bartender secretly provides a service delivering shipments of money to local gangsters. His criminal connections lead to his involvement in a robbery that goes disastrously wrong and digs up the long-buried secrets from his neighbourhood's past. Crime drama based on a short story by Dennis Lehane, starring Tom Hardy, Noomi Rapace and James Gandolfini in his final film role.(n)

programme.title: Gone Girl
programme.desc: A woman disappears without trace on her fifth wedding anniversary. Her husband contacts the police, but struggles to cope as his marriage is scrutinised by the media. As his behaviour grows stranger and more evasive, he finds himself accused of her murder. David Fincher's crime thriller based on Gillian Flynn's novel, starring Ben Affleck, Rosamund Pike and Neil Patrick Harris.(n)

programme.title: Like Someone in Love
programme.desc: A Tokyo student relies on prostitution to support herself. She is pressured by her pimp into visiting an elderly widower, but is surprised to find he only wants to talk to her. A close connection forms between them, which leads to her secret double life coming to light. Abbas Kiarostami's drama, starring Rin Takanashi and Tadashi Okuno. In Japanese.

programme.title: Sands of Iwo Jima
programme.desc: A tough, embittered US marine sergeant sets out to mould a group of raw recruits into men fit for action against the Japanese in the Pacific during the Second World War. Although his training methods are often brutal, his controversial approach looks set to pay dividends when they finally see real combat. Adventure, starring John Wayne, John Agar, Adele Mara and Forrest Tucker.

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter takes the lone survivor of a massacred party of settlers to an oasis, where he finds several other homesteaders and a military force have also sought shelter. They come under siege by a war party of Apaches, and face a struggle for survival - but an impending storm inspires a daring escape plan. Western, starring Rory Calhoun and Barbara Bates.

programme.title: Safari
programme.desc: Wealthy eccentric Sir Vincent Brampton arrives in Nairobi intent on hunting a legendary man-eating lion, and employs the services of disgraced big-game hunter Ken Duffield, who decides to use the expedition as an opportunity to settle an old score with the ruthless Kenyan terrorist who murdered his son. Adventure set during the Mau Mau Uprising in Kenya, starring Victor Mature, Roland Culver and Earl Cameron.

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A group of strangers, including a drunken doctor, a pregnant army officer's wife and an embezzling bank clerk, embarks on a dangerous journey across hostile territory. They are joined by an outlaw, falsely accused of murder, who helps them when a Sioux war party attacks. Remake of John Ford's Western, with Bing Crosby and Ann-Margret.

programme.title: Multiplicity
programme.desc: A workaholic whose demanding job often keeps him away from home hits on the idea of cloning himself so he can spend more time with his wife and kids. However, this is when his problems really begin, as the clones start to take over his house. Comedy, starring Michael Keaton, Andie MacDowell, Harris Yulin and Richard Masur.

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: A corporation that creates military robots seizes a chance to diversify into law enforcement when a Detroit cop is critically injured in a bombing. He is rebuilt as a crime-fighting cyborg, but struggles to regain his free will from his creators' control. Sci-fi thriller remake, starring Joel Kinnaman, Gary Oldman, Michael Keaton and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: Les Combattants
programme.desc: Premiere. A directionless man facing an uncertain future meets a woman who believes that civilisation is doomed to fall apart very soon. He follows her to an army boot camp, where she is hoping to learn survival skills, and romance blossoms as they struggle with the hardships of their training. Romantic drama, starring Adele Haenel and Kevin Azais. In French.

programme.title: Copycat
programme.desc: A gifted psychologist who is an authority on serial killers is left traumatised by an attempt on her life and becomes agoraphobic. Unable to leave her apartment, she nevertheless aids the police in the pursuit of a publicity-seeking mass murderer re-enacting famous killings. Thriller, with Sigourney Weaver, Holly Hunter, Harry Connick Jr, Dermot Mulroney, William McNamara and Will Patton.(n)

programme.title: The Black Knight
programme.desc: A humble sword-maker in the kingdom of King Arthur sets out to prove his worth as a knight in a bid to impress a nobleman's daughter. While fighting to foil an invasion, he discovers the attacking army is in league with traitors in the royal court. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Alan Ladd, Peter Cushing, Patricia Medina, Patrick Troughton and John Laurie.(n)

programme.title: Guns at Batasi
programme.desc: Rebels besiege the headquarters of a British battalion garrisoned in Africa, enraged by the officers' refusal to give up a prisoner. Meanwhile, the sergeant major struggles to maintain order in his increasingly tense surroundings. Drama, starring Richard Attenborough, Jack Hawkins, Flora Robson and Mia Farrow.(n)

programme.title: Cover Girl
programme.desc: Dancer Rusty Parker works in a small New York club with her choreographer boyfriend Danny McGuire, but gets a taste of fame when she wins a competition to appear on the cover of a prestigious magazine. This in turn leads to her starring in hit musical, though her success has a dramatic effect on her relationship with Danny. Musical comedy, starring Rita Hayworth and Gene Kelly.(n)

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: The ruthless captain of a US destroyer develops an obsession with tracking down a Russian submarine. As he drives his men harder, he fails to anticipate the consequences of his actions - leading to a fatal mistake. Cold War thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Martin Balsam, Wally Cox, Eric Portman and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Vehicle 19
programme.desc: An American ex-con travels to South Africa hoping to salvage his relationship with his estranged ex-girlfriend, only to discover a woman tied up in the boot of his rented car. He discovers she is a whistle-blower who could bring down the corrupt chief of police, and must protect her from the crooked cops trying to silence her. Action thriller, starring Paul Walker and Naima McLean.(n)

programme.title: The Iceman
programme.desc: A Mob henchman becomes one of the criminal underworld's most notorious contract killers, responsible for the deaths of over 100 men. He conceals his activities behind the normal facade of an all-American family man for years, keeping his wife and daughters in the dark about his deadly profession. Fact-based crime drama, starring Michael Shannon, Winona Ryder and Chris Evans.(n)

programme.title: American Reunion
programme.desc: Jim Levenstein and his old friends return to their home town for a high-school reunion. Struck by how much their lives have changed, they set out to relive the sexual misadventures of their adolescence, but only end up making bigger fools of themselves than they did as teenagers. Comedy sequel to the American Pie movies, starring Jason Biggs and Alyson Hannigan.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mary Ellen's baby is kidnapped by a girl traumatised by the loss of her own child.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Curtis is called up to serve in the medical corps in the Second World War as news reaches the town that a local man has been killed on the front line.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Willie Oleson's parents are shocked when their son announces he is planning to get married.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Isaiah makes a promise to a dying man that he will find a home for his little girl, only to realise the infant is a baby orang-utan which wreaks havoc in Walnut Grove. Meanwhile, Willie is finally ready to graduate and propose to his girlfriend, but struggles to find the courage to tell his parents that he does not want to attend college.

programme.title: Romance on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American travelling by train from Venice to Paris bumps into her former lover, and the pair try to understand why their initial romance ended so abruptly. Romantic drama, starring Cheryl Ladd and Stuart Wilson.

programme.title: Moonlight & Mistletoe
programme.desc: A businesswoman returns home to help out her Dad's business Santaland after he suffers an injury. Despite her initial reluctance, she soon comes to appreciate the family trade. Drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure, Tom Arnold, Christopher Wiehl and Barbara Niven.

programme.title: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, about religious fanatic Ervil LeBaron, who believed he had God's permission to kill anyone standing in the way of his drive for wealth and power. Starring Brian Dennehy, Tracy Needham and William Devane.

programme.title: Crown Heights
programme.desc: Two men living in a area surrounded by racial tension between the Jewish and Black communities try to bring their divided neighbourhood together through their passion for music in the aftermath of rioting. Fact-based drama, starring Howie Mandel, Mario Van Peebles and Jeremy Blackman.

programme.title: A Touch of Hope
programme.desc: A man discovers he has the abilities of a faith healer. Initially reluctant, he agrees to use his gift to help doctors, but only in emergency cases. However, many in the medical community are suspicious of his claims, a conflict that comes to a head when he is asked to bring a doubting doctor's daughter out of a coma. Fact-based drama, starring Anthony Michael Hall, CCH Pounder, Abraham Benrubi and Fay Masterson.

programme.title: Her Desperate Choice
programme.desc: A woman flees the authorities in an attempt to protect her daughter from the child's paedophile father and seeks the help of an underground organisation dedicated to protecting abused youngsters. Drama, with Kyle Secor, Faith Ford, Hanna R Hall and Nigel Bennett.

programme.title: Before He Wakes
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller about a greedy woman who marries and murders two wealthy husbands in succession, to acquire their fortunes, and almost succeeds in getting away scot-free. Starring Jaclyn Smith, Diana Scarwid, Hope Lange and Timothy Carhart.

programme.title: Ann Rule's The Stranger Beside Me
programme.desc: An aspiring crime reporter is hired to investigate a series of grisly, unsolved murders stretching from Utah to Seattle, only to discover the killer is one of her closest friends. Fact-based thriller, starring Bill Campbell, Barbara Hershey, Kevin Dunn and Suki Kaiser.

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange.

programme.title: 10th and Wolf
programme.desc: The son of a Pennsylvania mobster is determined not to follow in his father's footsteps, and instead joins the army, serving in the first gulf war. When he impulsively steals a jeep at the end of the conflict, the FBI offer him a way out of paying for his crime - go back to his old neighbourhood and infiltrate the Sicilian crime syndicate taking over the drug trade in the city. However, he soon realises his actions have placed his small time crook brother and cousin in danger. Thriller, starring James Marsden, Dennis Hopper, Giovanni Ribisi and Piper Perabo.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia responds to distressing news about the war by painting a local beauty spot so it will never be forgotten.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob befriends a boy who shares his love of flying, and they both fantasise about being pilots. However, reality brings them down to Earth with a bump.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Matthew goes to live with his biological father, leaving Mr Edwards feeling rejected and lonely. With Jonathan Hall Kovacs and Victor French.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: After moving his family from Wisconsin's `big woods' to Minnesota's prairie, pioneer Charles Ingalls settles on farmland by Plum Creek. He takes several jobs in a bid to acquire the deeds to his farm, but the multiple duties combined with stress take their toll. Drama, starring Martin Landau.(n)

programme.title: The Cry
programme.desc: Part one of two. Psychological thriller about a bereaved mother who becomes obsessed with another woman's baby. Still grieving over her own loss, child protection officer Meg Bartlet befriends new mother Christine Rearden, but the relationship turns sour when Meg sets out to prove baby Eleanor's breathing problems are the result of abuse. Starring Sarah Lancashire, Emma Cunniffe, Anthony Calf, James Laurenson and Joe Duttine.(n)

programme.title: Miracle of the Heart
programme.desc: After losing a patient in surgery, doctor Nathan Andrews takes a break from his career and returns to his small town roots. A chance encounter with an old acquaintance offers him a promise for the future, only for a tragedy to call into question everything he believes. Drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Rebecca Gayheart and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Hearts Adrift
programme.desc: A mother and daughter's humdrum small-town life is radically changed by a trip to spend a weekend with a family friend in the country. Romantic drama, starring Sydney Penny, Scott Reeves, Kathleen Noone and Nicolas Coster.(n)

programme.title: Gone in the Night
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama. A couple search for clues to the whereabouts of their seven-year-old daughter, snatched from her bed as they slept. Drama, starring Shannen Doherty, Kevin Dillon, Edward Asner and Dixie Carter.(n)

programme.title: Visions of Terror
programme.desc: A police psychologist begins counselling a traumatised cop whose partner died in the line of duty, and soon realises there is more to the case than meets the eye. Crime drama, starring Barbara Eden, Ted Marcoux and David Marciano.(n)

programme.title: Sudden Fury
programme.desc: Three abused brothers are suspected of complicity in the murder of their callous adoptive parents. Fact-based drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Johnny Galecki, Gregory Harrison and Linda Kelsey.(n)

programme.title: She Woke Up
programme.desc: A wealthy heiress is left in a coma by a mystery assailant, but regains consciousness a year later and sets out to discover the attacker's identity. Thriller, with Lindsay Wagner, David Dukes, Frances Sternhagen and Maureen Mueller.(n)

programme.title: Untamed Love
programme.desc: A teacher who specialises in tutoring children with learning difficulties forms a close bond with a violent girl traumatised by years of physical and psychological abuse. Fact-based drama, starring Cathy Lee Crosby, Ashlee Lauren, John Getz and Richard Fancy.(n)

programme.title: Bloody Sunday
programme.desc: Fact-based drama telling the story of the events of January 30, 1972, when soldiers attached to the Parachute Regiment opened fire on a civil rights march taking place in Londonderry, killing 13 unarmed civilians. Directed by Paul Greengrass and starring James Nesbitt, Nicholas Farrell, Tim Pigott-Smith and Kathy Keira Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Reflections on a Crime
programme.desc: A prison guard begins a friendship with a woman awaiting execution for the murder of her husband, little anticipating the amazing tale she will reveal to him on the night before she dies. Thriller, starring Mimi Rogers, Billy Zane, John Terry and Kurt Fuller.(n)

programme.title: The Judge
programme.desc: Part two of two. A lawyer defends a controversial judge arrested for soliciting, but soon uncovers a sorry tale involving everything from death and police corruption to an over-ambitious prosecutor. Courtroom drama, starring Chris Noth, Edward James Olmos, Lolita Davidovich and Charles Durning.

programme.title: Child of Rage
programme.desc: A priest and his wife adopt seven-year-old Catherine and her brother Eric, but quickly realise the girl's troubled past has left her suffering from violent behavioural problems. Drama, starring Mel Harris, Dwight Schultz and Ashley Peldon.

programme.title: Mary Higgins Clark: Loves Music, Loves to Dance
programme.desc: A tenacious TV producer sets out to get to the bottom of a friend's murder, certain that the killer was a man her pal had met online. However, it soon becomes clear that her very personal investigation has served only to place her in danger as well. Mystery, based on Mary Higgins Clark's novel, starring Patsy Kensit, Cynthia Preston and Dean McDermott.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prevent an injured orphan from killing a raccoon and take him under their wing - but soon wonder whether they have made the right decision.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and the family are puzzled by the cold manner of their new neighbours - until it comes to light that they suffered at the hands of the Nazis and are still afraid to reveal their ancestry.

programme.title: The Murder of Mary Phagan
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Jewish factory owner in 1930s Georgia is unjustly accused of murder. Despite all the evidence pointing in another direction, an ambitious prosecutor and an unscrupulous journalist whip up a frenzy of anti-semitism against the suspect. However, the state governor sees through the bigotry and does everything in his power to see justice is done. Fact-based drama, starring Jack Lemmon, Peter Gallagher, Kevin Spacey and Richard Jordan.

programme.title: For the Love of a Child
programme.desc: Two inspirational women who carry out extensive work with abused, neglected and abandoned children around the world. Drama, starring Peri Gilpin, Teri Polo and Maria Del Mar.

programme.title: The Return
programme.desc: A woman receives a conditional discharge from prison after serving 10 years for killing her husband in a drunken rage - an event she cannot even remember. Rebuilding her life proves easier said than done, especially when she discovers that if she tries to contact her teenage son or touches alcohol again, she will be sent back to jail. Drama, starring Julie Walters Neil Dudgeon, Ger Ryan and Pauline McLynn.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A newcomer arrives in town looking for a job and a place to stay, but suspicions are raised that he may be a German spy.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: There's No Place Like Home - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Ingalls, Oleson and Garvey families get tired of the bustling city life and decide to return to Walnut Grove, where a shock awaits them.

programme.title: Wife, Mother, Murderer
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small town roots murders her husband, attempts to poison her child and assumes multiple fake identities, even going so far as to fake the death of one of her aliases and take on the guise of her own identical twin sister. Fact-based drama, starring Judith Light and David Ogden Stiers.

programme.title: The Forget-Me-Not Murders
programme.desc: A policeman races against time to find a serial killer who leaves dried flowers next to each of his victims, and the chase becomes even more desperate when he learns that his goddaughter could be next on the murderer's list. Detective thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Tyne Daly, Cliff Gorman and Neve Campbell.

programme.title: Dangerous Indiscretions
programme.desc: Kate Ricketts narrates a documentary examining the British monarchy in the aftermath of the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, and the Windsor family's assorted feuds and divorces. Featuring archive footage of Prince Charles, Sarah Ferguson and Camilla Parker-Bowles.

programme.title: Edward and Sophie: The True Story
programme.desc: Documentary about Prince Edward's relationship with Sophie Rhys-Jones.

programme.title: Murder of Innocence
programme.desc: A woman's descent into insanity is witnessed by her confused and alienated husband as he battles the authorities to prove she is a danger to society. Drama, starring Valerie Bertinelli and Stephen Caffrey.

programme.title: While Justice Sleeps
programme.desc: A widow is initially delighted by an old family friend's interest in her eight-year-old daughter, but soon starts to suspect the child is being abused. Drama, starring Cybill Shepherd, Tim Matheson, Karis Bryant and Dion Anderson.(n)

programme.title: My Body, My Child
programme.desc: A middle-aged Catholic woman becomes pregnant, but her doctor refuses to believe her and prescribes drugs that have unforeseen effects on her unborn child. She must choose between continuing the pregnancy, knowing her baby will be born severely deformed, or having an abortion in defiance of her faith. Drama, starring Vanessa Redgrave and Jack Albertson.(n)

programme.title: Perry Mason: The Case of the Heartbroken Bride
programme.desc: The attorney is invited to the wedding of his niece, a famous popstar. During the wedding ceremony things are disrupted by the bride's uncle threatening her father. Security overpower him and take him into a side room, but later he is found dead - with the bride standing over him. Is she guilty or is she being framed? Mystery, starring Raymond Burr, Linda Blair, Ronny Cox, Barbara Hale and William R Moses.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: An old army friend of John's visits and causes havoc among the Waltons by starting a fire and accidentally shooting their dog.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob ends up in hospital with appendicitis, forcing Grandpa and John-Boy to rely on a famous author to help them complete an important contract.(n)

programme.title: In the Line of Duty: The Price of Vengeance
programme.desc: A tough-talking hitman sets out to bump off a quartet of local businessman who stand in his way - but he decides to do away with a hard-nosed cop into the bargain, a decision that makes him the target of a furious vendetta. Crime thriller, starring Dean Stockwell, Michael Gross and Brent Jennings.(n)

programme.title: Stranger in the Family
programme.desc: A teenager is involved in a tragic car accident, leaving him with severe amnesia. During his struggle to come to terms with alienation and the consequent rebellion that ensues, his family are forced to accept the boy they once knew so well is now a stranger. Fact-based drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Teri Garr, Randle Mell and Sierra Samuel.(n)

programme.title: A Child's Wish
programme.desc: A distressed man takes time off work to help look after his cancer-stricken daughter, only to be fired by his uncaring boss, prompting the start of a long legal battle which even attracts the President's attention. Fact-based drama, starring John Ritter, Tess Harper, Anna Chlumsky and Bill Clinton as himself.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob and Ben are consumed with jealousy as each would rather be with the other's girlfriend. Mamie Baldwin realises she may not have long left to live.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jenny blames herself when her father dies following a family outing, and despite Laura and Almanzo's attempts to comfort her, slips into a deep depression.(n)

programme.title: Stranger in the Family
programme.desc: A teenager is involved in a tragic car accident, leaving him with severe amnesia. During his struggle to come to terms with alienation and the consequent rebellion that ensues, his family are forced to accept the boy they once knew so well is now a stranger. Fact-based drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Teri Garr, Randle Mell and Sierra Samuel.(n)

programme.title: First Do No Harm
programme.desc: A woman decides to seek alternative forms of treatment for her epileptic son after the conventional methods employed by his doctors fail to have an impact on his welbeing. However, she encounters resistance from members of the medical establishment, who seek to take legal action to stop her removing her child from the hospital. Drama, based on a true story, starring Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: Diana: A Portrait
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life of Diana, Princess of Wales. Including an interviewer with biographer Andrew Morton.(n)

programme.title: 50 Glorious Years
programme.desc: Documentary examining the life of Elizabeth II and her husband Prince Philip.(n)

programme.title: Crown Heights
programme.desc: Two men living in a area surrounded by racial tension between the Jewish and Black communities try to bring their divided neighbourhood together through their passion for music in the aftermath of rioting. Fact-based drama, starring Howie Mandel, Mario Van Peebles and Jeremy Blackman.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Federal Boobie Inspector. Ray visits a Hollywood power player in an attempt to get the Russian mob off his back and unearths a secret Ezra shared in the past. Meanwhile, Lena and an ex-girlfriend take Abby out on the town to help her confront fears over a recent health diagnosis; and Mickey offers his boys a job prospect and tries to assimilate back into the family(n)

programme.title: Roadies
programme.sub-title: The City Whose Name Must Not Be Spoken
programme.desc: The City Whose Name Must Not Be Spoken. The crew become victims of a mythical rock and roll curse and try to break it by completing some odd tasks. Meanwhile, Bill and Shelli search for Rick, the band's hard-living bassist, who has gone missing(n)

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: (2004) Jonathan Demme's remake of John Frankenheimer's 1962 thriller is updated to the Gulf War, with Ben Marco (Denzel Washington) as a member of a patrol saved by Raymond Shaw (Liev Schreiber). Shaw was awarded the Medal of Honor for his bravery and is now standing for vice-president, under the stern eye of his controlling mother Eleanor (Meryl Streep). But, unlike in the original film, she's a pawn not of the communists but of big business, who want their own man in the White House. Marco, however, keeps having disturbing nightmares and discovers he is being controlled not by brain-washing but by implanted chips. As he attempts to unravel the mystery and stop Eleanor's plot, so she is equally determined that her son will not be thwarted(n)

programme.title: Woman in Gold
programme.desc: In this inspiring drama based on real events, a Jewish woman attempts to reclaim her family's property, which was stolen six decades earlier during WWII. With the help of an ambitious young lawyer, she starts legal proceedings in various countries around the world(n)

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: Biopic of artist Margaret Keane, who lived in obscurity while her husband Walter shot to fame by claiming that he was responsible for her popular portraits of little children with saucer-like eyes(n)

programme.desc: A Hollywood movie star falls for an unassuming British bookstore owner while in London to promote her latest film(n)

programme.title: Trainspotting
programme.desc: A Scottish heroin addict tries to kick the habit, but struggles because of out-of-control mates(n)

programme.title: What If
programme.desc: In this warm and funny romantic comedy, a cynical med-school dropout who has been burned by love hits it off with an aspiring animator in a committed relationship. They quickly become friends, but must contend with the reality that they mean much more to each other than that(n)

programme.title: Good Morning, Vietnam
programme.desc: Imported by the Army for an early a.m. radio show, Cronauer blasts the formerly staid, sanitized airwaves with a constant barrage of rapid-fire humor and the hottest hits from back home. The G.I.s love him but the brass is up in arms!(n)

programme.title: Punch-Drunk Love
programme.desc: Screenwriter-director Paul Thomas Anderson ("Boogie Nights") turns romantic comedies upside down with this bizarre and provocative character study. Adam Sandler is superb as an unstable businessman who's trying to woo his sister's eccentric friend (Emily Watson) despite considerable emotional baggage. Philip Seymour Hoffman(n)

programme.title: Miami Vice
programme.desc: Writer and director Michael Mann updates the groundbreaking television crime series he created in the 1980s with this stylish thriller. Ricardo Tubbs (Jamie Foxx) and Sonny Crockett (Colin Farrell) are two police detectives working undercover in Florida; Tubbs is smart, cool, and resourceful, while Crockett has his own way of doing things, though he stays close enough to the rules to stay out of trouble. Their latest assignment is to get the goods on Arcangel de Jesus Montoya (Luis Tosar), a local drug kingpin whose men are believed to be responsible for a handful of recent murders. In order to infiltrate Montoya's operation, Tubbs and Crockett pose as powerboat racers willing to use their talents to pilot drug-smuggling ships for the right price. The detectives' ruse works, but as they dig deeper into Montoya's inner circle, they become involved in a dangerous operation that will take them to Haiti and Cuba, where neither the Miami Police Force nor the United States government can help them if things go wrong. Crockett also begins walking a risky path when he begins an affair with Isabella (Gong Li), a woman high up in Montoya's organization. Miami Vice marked Michael Mann's third consecutive directorial effort with Jamie Foxx after Ali and Collateral(n)

This anthology film attempts a black-oriented, socially conscious spin on the horror genre

programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: Terrifying shocker about a foul-smelling creature that raises a horrific stink in an abandoned desert town. The monster targets a quintet of young travelers who get lost. Devon Gummersall stars as the brilliant but blind leader of the pack. Written and directed by Dave Payne

programme.title: The Hunters
programme.desc: After the mysterious disappearance of two archeologists who retrieve fairy-tale objects, it's up to their teenage sons to step up and save the day

programme.title: Russell Mulcahy's Tale of the Mummy
programme.desc: Chiller in the tradition of the cult Hammer Horror movies in which the curse of Talos the Mummy is unleashed, bringing death and destruction to the world as Talos seeks immortality. Horror film stalwart Christopher Lee plays the ill-fated archaeologist who first breaks the seal of the mummy's tomb

programme.title: Judgment Day
programme.desc: This sci-fi thriller finds the world in imminent danger when a collision in outer space sends huge pieces of interstellar debris on a path headed straight for Earth. A scientist has designed a system that would stop the largest meteor fragments from striking the earth, but a fanatical religious cult have made it their business to stop him. A convicted murderer (Ice-T) with ties to the group must now join forces with an FBI agent (Suzy Amis) to free the scientist from the cult's clutches and prevent millions of needless deaths. Mario Van Peebles and Linden Ashby appear in supporting roles

programme.title: Nightlight
programme.desc: Teens playing a spooky flashlight game in the woods at night get more than they bargained for when a demon is awakened by their shenanigans

programme.title: The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?
programme.desc: A documentary look at why the planned 1998 film "Superman Lives" was scrapped. The superhero flick would have starred Nicolas Cage as the Man of Steel and been directed by Tim Burton

programme.title: Atari: Game Over
programme.desc: An exploration of the decline of video-game giant Atari and its secret burial of unsold "E.T." game cartridges in a New Mexico landfill

programme.title: Intruders
programme.desc: A mysterious beast stalks innocent children in this thriller from Spanish director Juan Carlos Fresnadillo. In the 1980s, Juan (Izan Corchero) is a young boy with an active imagination and a talent for writing stories. However, he is being terrorized by a strange creature that lurks in his room late at night and doesn't seem to have a face. Juan's mother Luisa (Pilar Lopez de Ayala) is skeptical at first, but comes to believe demonic forces are at work and asks a local priest (Daniel Bruehl) to chase the spirits out. However, it soon becomes obvious Satan is not the one to blame for the horrible visits. Three decades later, John (Clive Owen) and Susanna (Carice van Houten) are the parents of Mia (Ella Purnell), a 13-year-old girl. John is fiercely protective of his daughter, and when she's attacked in her room late one night, he's determined to find whoever or whatever is responsible. As it happens, Mia is being visited by Hollowface, a monster similar to the one who was stalking Juan, and he's just as difficult to frighten away. Juan Carlos Fresnadillo's first directorial project after his commercial breakthrough with 28 Weeks Later, Intruders was an official selection at the 2011 Toronto International Film Festival

programme.title: The Last Survivors
programme.desc: Though not officially acknowleged at the time of its telecast, the made-for-TV movie The Last Survivors was a rehash of the 1957 theatrical feature Abandon Ship; both in fact were based on the same true story. A typhoon at sea has sunk a ship, leaving Alexander Holmes (Martin Sheen) as the highest ranking officer to survive. Commandeering a crowded lifeboat, Holmes must face the fact that the tiny vessel is in danger of floundering itself--and there's another typhoon on the way. Thus is Holmes forced to "play God", decided who among the passengers will allowed to remain in the lifeboat, and who will be cast overboard. Broadcast by NBC, The Last Survivors debuted on March 4, 1975. ~Saw Film/TV Guide/Marrill/Internet/Expert(n)

programme.desc: In this claustrophobic, pulse-pounding thriller, a ragtag band of postapocalyptic survivors take shelter in an abandoned farmhouse, but they soon come under siege from forces looking to wipe them out(n)

programme.desc: Wrestling superstar "Stone Cold" Steve Austin packs a wallop in this action-packed adventure. He plays Jack Conrad, a convicted murderer who's purchased from a Central American prison and sent to battle nine other killers in a made-for-TV death match that is being broadcast as part of a reality-television extravaganza. Former European soccer star Vinnie Jones costars as McStarley, a sociopathic former Special Forces operative. Directed by Scott Wiper, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in Antoine Fuqua's thriller as Bob Swagger, an ex-Special Ops sharpshooter. Called out of retirement by Col Isaac Johnson to help foil an assassination attempt on the President, he finds himself framed as the assassin. Injured and on the run, he can only rely on Sara Fenn, the girlfriend of his ex-partner, and FBI agent Nick Memphis, who's come across evidence of the conspiracy. The three now have to evade Johnson and his cohorts in a race to prove their innocence in this intelligent action movie(n)

programme.title: Wild Bill

programme.title: Free Money
programme.desc: The Swede is a prison warden who rules his family and his prison with an iron hand in one of the coldest parts of North Dakota. When an inmate dies under mysterious circumstances, the FBI sends in agent Karen Polarski to investigate. On the home front, the sons-in-law of the Swede, Larry and Bud accidentally discover that a train loaded with millions of dollars of unmarked currency slated to be destroyed will soon be passing through. The temptation is too great and the guys hatch a scheme to rob the train. Of course, the biggest obstacle in their way is the Swede…

programme.title: The DUFF
programme.desc: In this uproarious comedy, a teen is devastated to learn that her classmates consider her the "designated ugly fat friend." In response, she enlists a jock's help in regaining her confidence, and plots to dethrone the school's queen bee(n)

programme.title: Freedom Writers
programme.desc: A young teacher inspires her class of at-risk students to learn tolerance, apply themselves, and pursue education beyond high school(n)

programme.title: Play It Forward
programme.desc: In this emotional documentary, Hall-of-Fame NFL tight-end Tony Gonzalez continues his dream to win a Super Bowl in his final professional season, while simultaneously supporting his brother (who's football career stalled due to injury) in a journey to become a firefighter. Andrea Nevins directs this heartfelt story, with former NFL-er Michael Strahan serving as an executive producer(n)

programme.title: Hidalgo
programme.desc: A Pony Express rider enters his scrappy mustang in a race against Arabian thoroughbreds(n)

programme.title: Meet the Hitlers
programme.desc: This documentary release explores the age-old question, "What's in a name?" by looking at the lives of several people who share a surname with Adolf Hitler. The film shows how individuals react differently to having a name that is tied to one of history's most notorious villains. Directed by Matthew Ogens and released as part of the "Morgan Spurlock Presents" series(n)

programme.title: Girl on the Edge
programme.desc: A teen struggles to overcome trauma she endured from a social-media event that also opened old childhood wounds. She is reluctantly sent to a healing center by her worried parents, where she bonds with a horse and is helped through her troubles by caring staff and other young people like her(n)

programme.title: Lucky Number Slevin
programme.desc: An innocent man visiting a friend in New York City becomes embroiled in a dangerous series of events after being mistaken for the very man he has come to the city to see in director Paul McGuigan's labyrinthine murder mystery. Upon arriving at the empty apartment of his old friend Nick, the unassuming Slevin (Josh Hartnett) is troubled to hear the voice of his missing friend's next door neighbor Lindsay (Lucy Liu) expressing concern as to Nick's safety and whereabouts. When Slevin ventures into Lindsay's apartment only to be greeted by the uninviting fist of a thuggish mob henchman, he quickly realizes that Nick is indeed in grave danger. Soon summoned by the big boss and accused of being the deeply indebted Nick, Slevin's attempts to prove his identity are foiled by the fact that his wallet had been stolen upon arrival in the city. With time running out and a complex plot to assassinate one of the city's most powerful crime bosses slowly coming into focus, the arrival of a notorious hit-man named Mr. Goodkat (Bruce Willis) forces Slevin to step up his desperate search and reclaim his identity before he's forced to pay a debt that could cost him his life(n)

programme.title: Stretch and Bobbito: Radio That Changed Lives
programme.desc: Popular '90s hip-hop DJs Stretch and Bobbito are profiled in this documentary(n)

programme.title: 11 Blocks
programme.desc: A man must fight gangs and a hitman to stay alive after being evicted from his home in this heart-pounding action thriller.(n)

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Engineer Dev Patel reprograms a police droid so it can think and feel, but there are dangerous consequences. Sci-fi action with Hugh Jackman and Sigourney Weaver. (2015)(116 mins)(n)

programme.title: Stop at Nothing: The Lance Armstrong Story
programme.desc: A look at Lance Armstrong's doping scandal includes interviews with his former teammates, friends and enemies(n)

programme.title: Knuckleball!
programme.desc: This entertaining documentary profiles two baseball pitchers who have managed to master the unpredictable and difficult-to-control knuckleball: Tim Wakefield and R.A. Dickey(n)

programme.title: Holy Man
programme.desc: Jeff Goldblum plays Ricky Hayman, whose boss gives him just two weeks to turn his failing shopping cable channel around. But nothing Hayman or Ivy League graduate Kate Newell do can increase viewing figures or sales, until, following a car crash, they meet 'G', an enigmatic holy man, whose wisdom and insight change the channel's fortunes and their lives(n)

programme.title: The Way of the Gun
programme.desc: Ryan Phillippe and Benicio Del Toro star as a pair of criminals who kidnap a woman pregnant with the surrogate child of a millionaire, who just happens to have a small army of armed guards and a salty hit man at his disposal. James Caan, Taye Diggs, Juliette Lewis, Scott Wilson(n)

programme.title: Iverson
programme.desc: An in-depth documentary on the career and legacy of 11-time NBA All-Star Allen Iverson, who rejected NBA convention and embraced hip-hop culture. The film examines his troubled youth, his years at Georgetown and his career with the Philadelphia 76ers. Included: interviews with Dwyane Wade, Tom Brokaw, John Thompson and Larry Brown(n)

programme.title: Spring Broke
programme.desc: The raucous history of the infamous spring break revelries in Daytona Beach, Fla., that began in the early 1960s is chronicled(n)

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook. Crime thriller(n)

programme.title: Brad Williams: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Comedian Brad Williams delivers a stand-up set that tackles race and political correctness, as well as how his father raised him to deal with adversity(n)

programme.title: War
programme.desc: An FBI agent whose partner and family were killed by a notorious assassin sets out for revenge as the elusive triggerman sparks a sprawling gang war between the triads and the yakuza in the feature debut from prolific music video director Phillip Atwell. FBI sgent Jack Crawford (Jason Statham) is a man driven by vengeance. After his partner, Tom Lone (Terry Chen), and his family fell to bullets fired by infamous hitman Rogue (Jet Li), Crawford makes it his life mission to ferret out the slippery killer. Complications arise when it begins to appear as if Rogue has a mission of his own to carry out, and as triad boss Chang (John Lone) prepares for all-out war against yakuza boss Shiro (Ryo Ishibashi), Crawford and Rogue also come face to face as the secrets of the past emerge in a hail of gunfire(n)

programme.title: Showtime Championship Boxing
programme.desc: Ruslan Provodnikov vs. John Molina Jr. in a super-lightweight bout in Verona, N.Y(n)

programme.title: Dr. T and the Women
programme.desc: (2000) Richard Gere plays Dr Sullivan Travis, top gynaecologist, happily married to Kate (Farrah Fawcett) and looking forward to the wedding of his daughter Dee (Kate Hudson). But when his wife loses her grip on reality, Gere copes by finding solace with Bree (Helen Hunt), the golfing pro at his club. As she shows him how to improve his 'technique', he must decide between family and love in Robert Altman's comedy/ drama

programme.title: Whore
programme.desc: The life of a jaded L.A. prostitute is described in this haunting drama, through flashbacks of her past marriage, brutal, inhumane abuse and her time on the streets

programme.title: Wish You Well
programme.desc: In this dramatic film starring Academy Award winner Ellen Burstyn, Josh Lucas and Mackenzie Foy a young girl and her family move to her great-grandmother's farm in Virginia after their father is killed in a car accident. In time she learns more about her dad and follows in his footsteps as a writer. Based on the New York Times Bestselling novel by David Baldacci. Directed by Darnell Martin

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: Director Eduardo Sanchez ("The Blair Witch Project") helmed this frightening chiller about newlyweds Yul and Melissa (Tim Chiou, Amy Smart), who arrive in China to meet Yul's family only to have their idyllic getaway take a turn for the worse after they become stranded in a remote village

programme.title: That Gal...Who Was in That Thing: That Guy 2
programme.desc: Eight actresses discuss their various experiences in Hollywood in this eye-opening documentary, and wrestle with plastic surgery, race, sexism, nudity, recognition, double standards, age and family

programme.title: All Over the Guy
programme.desc: Contemporary romantic comedy about the quest to find the "one" when "the one" doesn't know he's the "one." It explores the unlikely pairing of two 20-somethings thrown together by their respective best friends in hopes of igniting their own romance. They do everything they can to NOT fall in love, but finally they overcome the dysfunction of their parents and surrender to their hearts

programme.title: Helicopter Mom
programme.desc: An overbearing mom decides that college would be more affordable if her son were to win an LGBT scholarship, so she outs him to his entire high school. However, he might not be gay

programme.title: The Wicked Within
programme.desc: A supernatural being torments a family one year after the death of their daughter

programme.title: Revolutionary Road
programme.desc: An incisive adaptation of Richard Yates's acclaimed novel about a 1950s suburban couple who become frustrated with their lives and struggle to find fulfillment

programme.title: The DUFF
programme.desc: A teenager is devastated to learn that her classmates consider her the "designated ugly fat friend". In response, she enlists help in regaining her confidence, and plots to dethrone the school's queen bee

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: Michael Caine, in his breakthrough role, stars as Alfie Elkins, a shallow and amoral sexual hedonist whose series of amorous adventures lead eventually to loneliness in Lewis Gilbert's swinging-sixties comedy drama

programme.title: Ginger & Rosa
programme.desc: Rebellious London teens Ginger and Rosa find their friendship tested against the backdrop of the Cuban Missile Crisis in this period drama from writer/director Sally Potter (Yes, Rage). The year is 1962. As the international dispute between the Soviet Union and the U.S. threatens to cast a shadow over the entire world, Ginger (Elle Fanning) seeks solace in the arts as Rosa (Alice Englert) favors such distractions as cigarettes and boys. Meanwhile, as the bond between the two girls is strengthened by their shared disdain for their respective mothers, Ginger's free-spirited father Roland (Alessandro Nivola) encourages his daughter to protest while sparking a twinkle in the eye of smitten Rosa. But for Ginger, the pain of her parents' breakup becomes too much to endure, eventually driving her into the company of a compassionate gay couple (Timothy Spall andOliver Platt) and their good friend Bella (Annette Bening), a poet. As the future of mankind begins to look increasingly grim, Ginger and Rosa both realize that the days of their friendship might be numbered whether the world ends in nuclear annihilation or life continues on as usual

programme.title: Girl on the Edge
programme.desc: A teen struggles to overcome trauma she endured from a social-media event that also opened old childhood wounds. She is reluctantly sent to a healing center by her worried parents, where she bonds with a horse and is helped through her troubles by caring staff and other young people like her

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: Gulf War hero Raymond is running for vice president, backed by his ruthless mother. But Raymond's unit leader Ben suspects that the squad was brainwashed in the Gulf and that Raymond is a security threat

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: A romantic trip to China turns into a lunar nightmare for a pair of happy newlyweds when their taxi driver ditches them in a remote village, and the locals offer them up as sacrifices for the menacing moon creatures that return to Earth annually to replenish their ranks. According to Chinese legend, the dead return to Earth on the seventh month of the lunar year, when the moon glows full in the night sky. America-born Yul (Tim Chiou) and his new wife Melissa (Amy Smart) had just arrived in China to meet Yul's family when their idyllic getaway takes a sudden turn for the worse. When night falls and their tour guide leaves them stranded in a darkened, boarded-up village, Yul and Amy quickly realize that this wasn't a planned stop. Once a year, the lunar creatures return to Earth in search of a sacrifice. Yul and Amy have just been offered up, and now in order to avoid being assimilated into the collective that pursues them through the darkened forest, they will have to survive until the morning light casts the frightful beasts back to the moon for another year(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie
programme.desc: Rat on a Cheeto. Antoinette makes a harrowing confession when she confronts Jackie about her addiction and it has a sobering affect on Jackie. Later, Jackie comes to a crossroads when she finds drugs in Grace's room. Meanwhile, Akalitus names Zoey nurse of the month; and Coop is named chief(n)

programme.title: Nurse Jackie
programme.desc: The Lady With the Lamp. Jackie detoxes at home and dreams she is back working at the hospital, where she meets a mysterious patient who exposes Jackie's greatest fear. Meanwhile, Frank objects to Grace moving back home; and Jackie makes a difficult decision concerning Frank(n)

programme.title: L Word Mississippi: Hate the Sin
programme.desc: Examining the unique challenges and struggles facing a group of lesbians who live in the conservative Deep South(n)

programme.title: Helicopter Mom
programme.desc: An overbearing mother (Nia Vardalos) decides that college would be more affordable if her son Lloyd (Jason Dolley) were to win an LGBT scholarship, so she outs him to his entire high school. However, Lloyd has yet to out himself, and still wonders if he is actually gay or straight(n)

programme.title: One Direction 'Where We Are' Live From San Siro Stadium
programme.desc: Boyband superstars One Direction perform live at Milan's San Siro Stadium, in Milan. Tracks include the hits 'Story Of My Life', 'What Makes You Beautiful', and many more(n)

programme.title: What If
programme.desc: In this warm and funny romantic comedy, a cynical med-school dropout who has been burned by love hits it off with an aspiring animator in a committed relationship. They quickly become friends, but must contend with the reality that they mean much more to each other than that(n)

programme.title: Like Sunday, Like Rain
programme.desc: Troubled 23-year-old musician Eleanor (Leighton Meester) becomes an au pair for lonely 12-year-old cello prodigy Reggie (Julian Shatkin), setting the stage for a friendship that leads to profound healing for both(n)

programme.title: Duets
programme.desc: Director Bruce Paltrow teams with his Oscar-winning daughter Gwyneth Paltrow for this road comedy with music. Paltrow plays Liv, a struggling professional singer whose meets her father, Ricky Dean (Huey Lewis), for the first time at the funeral of her mother. As it turns out, both Liv and Ricky supplement the income from few-and-far-between gigs by singing in karaoke contests, and soon father and daughter are competing on the same circuit. Meanwhile, Todd Woods (Paul Giamatti), a salesman who has grown disenchanted with his job, his family, and his life, picks up a hitch-hiker named Reggie Kane (Andre Braugher), and during a stop at a tavern, they discover they make a good duet team while belting out a version of "Try A Little Tenderness." And waitress Suzi Loomis (Maria Bello) sweet talks Billy (Scott Speedman), a cabbie, into driving her to Omaha, where the national karaoke finals will determine who does the best job of singing along with the records, as the lives of these six characters begin to intersect. Duets also features Angie Dickinson as Blair, Liv's grandmother who was once a showgirl in Frank Sinatra's Las Vegas floorshow; Brad Pitt was originally cast in Speedman's role but withdrew after he and Paltrow announced the end of their off-camera relationship(n)

programme.title: Song One
programme.desc: A young woman falls for her comatose brother's favorite musician in this romance set among the indie-music set in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: Heather McDonald: I Don't Mean to Brag
programme.desc: Comedian Heather McDonald performs a solo show and recounts the ways she tries to balance fame and family(n)

programme.desc: A young woman falls for her comatose brother's favorite musician in this romance set among the indie-music set in Brooklyn(n)

programme.sub-title: A Very Good Year for Murder
programme.desc: A Very Good Year for Murder. A birthday party for a rich Italian wine tycoon ends in murder, but Jessica Fletcher is on hand to unravel the mystery. Look out for young Billy Zane!

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Benedict Arnold Slipped Here. Someone is willing to kill for a dilapidated old house reputedly visited by Benedict Arnold and rumored to contain hidden treasure. Jessica: Angela Lansbury. Wilton Tibbles: David Clennon. Eve Simpson: Julie Adams. Alastair Andrews: Brian Bedford

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: Hartland Express. The Harts take a train trip and wind up protecting a Government witness. Mrs. Cuthbert: Florence Henderson. Jonathan: Robert Wagner. Farkiss: Bernie Kopell. Jennifer: Stefanie Powers

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: What Becomes a Murder Most?. Romantic mystery-adventure series about a husband-and-wife team who travel the world solving crimes and catching criminals in their search for the adventure that fuels their romance. Jonathan scrambles to protect his wife from becoming the next victim when two high-society ladies, who modelled luxurious furs with Jennifer for an advertising campaign, are found murdered

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Star. Matlock isn't afraid of the case against a horror-film director, who's charged with stabbing his star in an all-too-realistic murder scene. Catherine McKay: Anita Morris. Susan McKay: Yvette Nipar. Jack Burns: Joseph Hacker. Mitchell: Alan Arbus

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Con Man. Michelle tries to con a con man, a suspect in the murder of his partner, who scammed Matlock's client out of thousands of dollars. Jack McCarthy: David Birney. Madeline Medford: Patricia Charbonneau. Brian Davis: James Eckhouse. Matlock: Andy Griffith

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: Prescription Murder. TV-movie detective drama in which Lt Columbo investigates the case of a woman who was murdered during an attempted robbery, and finds himself paying a call to the office of the victim's psychiatrist husband

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Murder with Mirrors. Sloan's free tickets to a friend's magic show become an invitation to murder when the magician mysteriously dies on stage during his escape act

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Flashdance with Death. A dance instructor is shocked to discover that the owner of her studio has been murdered, and Steve's new girlfriend is charged

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Reunion with Murder. Amanda is a suspect in the murder of one of her former college roommates, the author of a soon-to-be published tell-all book about her sorority sisters

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Lily. Drama series about a detective doctor. When Dr Mark Sloan hunts for the murderer of a high-class call girl, he finds himself caught in the middle of a vice raid

programme.title: A Gift of Miracles
programme.desc: A woman finds a list of belongings her late mother—whom she never knew—planned to give away to specific people, so she sets out to fulfill her mother's wishes, gaining a better understanding of life along the way

programme.title: Healing Hands
programme.desc: Following a brush with death, a janitor (Eddie Cibrian) discovers that he can heal others with just his touch. He relishes his new ability until he realizes that it's taking a toll on his own health, forcing him to make an important decision. Lisa Sheridan, Patrick Duffy, Meagen Fay. Directed by Bradford May

programme.title: Signed, Sealed, Delivered: From the Heart
programme.desc: A prominent figure may fall because of a damaged letter the postal detectives are investigating. Meanwhile, Oliver, Shane, Norman and Rita all face the repercussions of Valentine's Day

programme.title: Candles on Bay Street
programme.desc: Based on the 1999 bestseller by K.C. McKinnon, this touching Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation stars Alicia Silverstone as Dee Dee, a single mom and professional candlemaker who returns to her Maine hometown after a lengthy absence. Having left town with a somewhat sullied reputation, she returns with apparently the best of intentions--bringing her 12-year-old son Trooper (Matthew Knight) along for the sentimental journey. Dee Dee's reappearance is initially met with hostility by veterinarian Lydia, whose husband (and coworker) Sam had once been Dee Dee's sweetheart. Ultimately, however, Lydia warms up to both her "rival" and her son--just before Dee Dee poignantly reveals the real reason for her unexpected homecoming. Filmed for television on location in Nova Scotia, Candles on Bay Street was first broadcast by CBS on November 26, 2006

programme.title: Magic of Ordinary Days
programme.desc: Adapted from the story by Ann Howard Creel, this Hallmark Hall of Fame presentation is set in rural Colorado in 1944. After she becomes pregnant by a departing soldier, Livy Dune, the wealthy, pampered daughter of a Denver minister (Daryl Shuttleworth), is forced to forever abandon her hopes of becoming an archeologist. To shield her from further scandal, Livy's father ships her off to a remote farm and arranges her marriage with shy farmer Ray Singleton (Skeet Ulrich), who is struggling to live up to his proscribed responsibilities to the wartime government. Clearly depressed by the situation, Livy does as well as she can to be polite and civil to her husband and his sister Martha (Mare Winningham), but it is clear that she'd rather be dead than married to a man she doesn't even know. For Ray's part, he is unfailingly generous and supplicative, but the realization that Livy doesn't want him makes him feel more inadequate than ever. With almost painful slowness, the two lost souls finally come to love and cherish one another, while each one also learns to forgive themselves for their own imagined shortcomings. A subplot involves the couple's relationship with a brace of well-educated Japanese girls living in a local internment camp. The Magic of Ordinary Days made its CBS debut on January 30, 2005

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Menace, Anyone?. A vintage episode of the compelling murder mystery series about a sleuthing writer. When a tennis star is killed by a bomb planted in his girlfriend's car, all the evidence points towards the girlfriend and her sister, although the sister has since died in a plane crash. 'Terminator' star Linda Hamilton guest stars

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Perfect Foil. This episode marks the first appearance of Calhoun Fletcher (Peter Bonerz), the troublesome--and trouble-prone--distant cousin of mystery writer Jessica Fletcher (Angela Lansbury). At the behest of her Aunt Mildred (played in a delightful cameo by filmdom's former "Blondie" Penny Singleton), Jessica agrees to look up Calhoun in New Orleans, where the Mardi Gras celebration is in full swing. It turns out that Jessica's sleuthing talents are desperately needed: Cal has been accused of murdering a famous--and famously crooked--professional poker player(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: If the Frame Fits. Jessica (Angela Lansbury) enters the rarefied world of art collecting when Julia Marcus Granger (Anne Scheeden), the heiress daughter of one of Jessica's oldest friends, is murdered. The most likely culprit turns out to be Julia's husband Donald (Christopher Allport), a known art thief. But Julia's sister Sabrina (Andra Millian) is convinced that Donald is innocent, and she prevails upon Jessica to prove it, leading our heroine down a twisted trail involving two entirely different sets of clues. This is the final episode of Murder She Wrote's second season(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Death Stalks the Big Top. Season Three of Murder She Wrote begins with the first episode of a two-part story, in which mystery writer Jessica Fletcher (Angela Lansbury) pays a visit to the Carmody Circus, an extremely small-time operation. It seems that Jessica has evidence that one of the circus' employees, a roustabout-clown who calls himself Carl, is actually her brother-in-law Neil (Jackie Cooper), who has long been presumed dead. No sooner does Jessica link up with Neil than the man is accused of murdering the circus' hateful manager Hank Sutter (Charles Napier). A young Courtney Cox appears as Neil's granddaughter, Carol Bannister(n)

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: Murder up their Sleeve. Max is kidnapped by a magician (Harry Blackstone) bent on taking over Hart Industries. Stefanie Powers, Robert Wagner. Marlene: Gretchen Wyler. Vickie: Barbra Horan. Wilkes: Bruce Glover(n)

programme.title: Hart to Hart
programme.desc: Harts Under Glass. A wealthy recluse kidnaps Jennifer for his living-creature collection. Nash: John Dehner. Jonathan: Robert Wagner. Caine: Ben Piazza(n)

programme.title: Matlock
programme.desc: The Fugitive. American drama following brilliant criminal defence attorney Ben Matlock. Matlock defends a man accused of murdering his own uncle whilst drunk(n)

programme.title: Matlock

programme.title: Columbo

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Shaker. When a friend dies in an earthquake, Dr. Sloan suspects foul play and tries to find out who's really at fault. Dr. Sloan: Dick Van Dyke. Martin: Allan Miller. Rick: Michael Easton. Ilene: Liz Vassey. Stuart: Harvey Jason(n)

programme.title: The Locket
programme.desc: Adapted from the bestselling novel by Richard Paul Evans, the made-for-TV The Locket stars Vanessa Redgrave as Esther Huish, an elderly, embittered resident of a nursing home. Into Esther's life comes young attendant Michael Keddington (Chad Willett), who like Esther has been forced to live a life of self-sacrifice and shattered dreams. Ever since his father deserted the family, Michael has cared for his ailing mother, putting his chances for college on what seems to be permanent hold. Now that his mother is dead, Michael is facing another crisis over which he has no control: The domineering father of Michael's fiancée has refused to bless the approaching wedding. Even so, Michael makes it his mission in life to make Esther's final years as comfortable and rewarding as possible; thus, he dedicates himself to locating Esther's long-lost love, using only a faded picture in a locket as his guide. As it turns out, it is Esther who "saves" Michael when the young man is accused of murdering another nursing-home resident. A CBS "Hallmark Hall of Fame" presentation, The Locket first aired on December 8, 2002(n)

programme.title: The Love Letter
programme.desc: An engaged thirtysomething (Campbell Scott) buys an antique desk and falls for its original owner---a Civil War-era woman (Jennifer Jason Leigh), with whom he begins a mysterious correspondence. Debra Zabriskie: Daphne Ashbrook. Beatrice Corrigan: Estelle Parsons. Everett Reagle: David Dukes. Directed by Dan Curtis(n)

programme.title: For the Love of Grace
programme.desc: After a troubled firefighter (Mark Consuelos) rescues a workaholic author (Chandra West), a friendship blooms that finds the two collaborating on a firehouse cookbook and reconsidering their futures. Corbin Bernsen also stars(n)

programme.title: The Color of Rain
programme.desc: When Gina's husband dies from cancer on Christmas Day, she is left to cope with the pain of his loss and find a way to move on(n)

programme.title: Always and Forever

programme.title: You're the Worst
programme.desc: Born Dead. Gretchen has a housewarming party to reconnect with old friends; Jimmy tries to assert that friends are for babies; and Edgar continues to pursue Lindsay, who meets her estranged husband's new girlfriend

programme.title: You're the Worst

programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: A heroin trafficker whose wife was abducted and murdered hires a haunted private investigator to track down the men who killed her in this brooding crime drama starring Liam Neeson. Matt Scudder (Neeson) was an NYPD cop having a quiet drink in a Washington Heights bar when a pair of armed robbers came in guns blazing. Giving chase, Scudder kills the robbers in the street, though a stray bullet turns a heroic moment tragic. Devastated, Scudder subsequently goes to work as an unlicensed private detective, working just outside of the law and surviving on generous gifts offered in exchange for his services. Now, tasked with rooting out the sadistic thugs who brutally murdered the wife of a wealthy drug dealer (Dan Stevens), Scudder scours the bars and back alleys of New York City in search of his elusive targets -- and the closer he gets, the more apparent it becomes that they are something much more sinister than your typical kidnappers

programme.title: Any Given Wednesday With Bill Simmons
programme.desc: Episode 4. Aaron Rodgers is the guest(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Face of the Franchise. In the Season 2 premiere, Spencer clashes with an old foe when he reluctantly agrees to be a guest on Jay Glazer's talk show, a mêlée that tarnishes his reputation and creates bad publicity for the company. Meanwhile, Ricky's blindsided by bad news before his 30th birthday party; and Charles enjoys being in the spotlight again(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood stars in this energetic and influential story about a maverick cop's obsessive attempts to bring a cold-blooded serial killer to justice before he kills again(n)

programme.title: The Black Dahlia
programme.desc: Former boxers and detectives Bucky Bleichert (Josh Hartnett) and Lee Blanchard (Aaron Eckhart) are in charge of investigating the brutal murder of Elizabeth Short (Mia Kirshner) an ambitious, aspiring b-movie actress known as The Black Dahlia. While Blanchards obsession to solve the case jeopardizes his relationship with the beautiful Kay (Scarlett Johansson), his partner Bleichert becomes attracted to Madeleine Linscott (Hilary Swank), a mysterious girl who belongs to one of the city¿s most powerful families and has suspicious ties to the victim. In this occasion, De Palma (Carrie, Scarface, Dressed to Kill, Mission Impossible) has woven a web of obsession, love, corruption, greed and perversion around a true story the brutal murder of the actress that shocked the United States in 1947 and still remains unsolved(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this hysterical big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party(n)

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: Four Oscars, including Best Picture and Best Director, went to Ron Howard's engrossing drama about John Nash, the volatile Nobel Prize-winning mathematician(n)

programme.title: Friends of God: A Road Trip With Alexandra Pelosi
programme.desc: A travelogue exploring the evangelical Christian community in the U.S. Included: visits to megachurches and religious theme parks; interviews with influential pastors, activists, educators and a Christian comic. Directed by Alexandra Pelosi ("Journeys With George")(n)

programme.title: American Pie
programme.desc: Coming-of-age comedy concerning four high-school friends who vow to lose their virginity by prom night(n)

programme.title: Evan Almighty

programme.title: The Boy Next Door
